iana.template_text:
MIME media type name : application

MIME subtype name : vnd.fujixerox.ddd

Required parameters : none

Optional parameters : none

Encoding considerations :
 This media type consists of binary data; appropriate
 encoding must be used on transports that cannot handle binary
 directly.

Security considerations :
 ddd is a 2D CAD format which is intended to be processed by
 applications described in the section "Applications which
 use this media". It dose not include executable data such as
 OLE objects, executable macros, and so forth. As such,
 there are not security risks, since it does not induce
 any particular behavior by an application.
 And it includes no information and has no architecture for data
 integrity and confidentiality. So if necessary, appropriate integrity
 or confidentiality services should be used on transports.

Interoperability considerations :
 This media type will be used by applications described below.
 There's no interoperability issues among users who use these
 applications.

Published specification :
 nothing

Applications which use this media :
 following applications of Fuji Xerox,
   - EDMICS 2000
   - DocuFile

Additional information :
 Magic number(s) : 44 00 00 DD hex, or 44 00 00 0D hex
 File extension(s) : ddd
 Macintosh file type code : none


Person & email address to contact for further information:
 Name: Masanori Onda
 E-mail: Masanori.Onda&fujixerox.co.jp

Intended usage: COMMON

Author/Change controller:
 Name: Masanori Onda
 Company: Fuji Xerox Co., Ltd.
 Section: Engineering Document Systems Business Unit
     Engineering Systems Group
 Address: 3-2-1, Sakado, Takatsu-ku, Kawasaki-shi, Kanagawa-ken
213-8508,
Japan
